questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Customer Service for its contact center.

The implementation must meet the following requirements:

• Use artificial intelligence to suggest similar cases.
• Close cases from the productivity pane.

You need to configure the feature for each requirement.

Which features should you configure? To answer, drag the appropriate features to the correct requirements. Each feature may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct tested in system and as per documentation
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/enable-agent-reject-notifications#enable-automatic-update-of-agent-presence

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The administrator enables in-app notifications.

Agents observe notifications in the app but are unsure which behavior triggers them.

You need to identify which notification will appear based on the activity of the agent.

Which notification belongs to each behavior? To answer, move the appropriate notifications to the correct agent behaviors. You may use each notification once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to move the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Seems right.

Reasoning from ChatGPT
Evaluating the Notification Types (from Microsoft Docs):

SMS Notification: Not relevant here since SMS messages are sent externally, not as in-app notifications.

Toast Notification: Appears as a temporary, dismissible pop-up in the application. This fits the requirement as agents can see it, acknowledge it, and dismiss it if needed.

Missed Notification: Used for missed communications like calls or messages. It is persistent until manually cleared, but it doesn’t seem suitable for a pre-call reminder.

Alert Notification: Used for critical issues that require immediate attention and cannot be dismissed without taking action. Since the question specifies that agents can dismiss the notification, this is not the best choice.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The company plans to enable in-app notifications to improve agent productivity.

Agents must be notified 15 minutes prior to any scheduled customer calls. The agents can dismiss the notification if needed.

You need to enable the notification.

Which notification type should you use?

choices.B: Set the Communication panel mode to Docked.
choices.E: Use the Case entity session template.
choices.C: Set the Communication panel mode to Minimized.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

Customer service representatives note that when they use customer workspaces to work on cases, they are unable to communicate with customers.

You need to resolve the issue.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Navigate to the Customer Service admin center.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
In a previous similar question the answers were B & C.

questions.question_text:
A company has used Dynamics 365 Customer Service with Omnichannel for more than a year.

The company has experienced several product recalls over the last three months. Customer agents must follow standardized answers, approved by the legal department, to respond to customer questions that are sent in from chats, texts, and phone conversations.

You need to configure the system.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
